name: The History of Sumer Quiz | Ancient History | 10 Questions

questions.text: The Sumerians were the inventors of the world's first writing system, a series of wedge-shaped markings called what?
The great Sumerian 'Epic of Gilgamesh' introduces us to King Gilgamesh. He was the 4th king of what ancient Sumerian city?
questions.explanation:
Uruk.

	His best friend was Enkidu...what a tragic ending Enkidu meets!

questions.text: Which title was given to a king who ruled a city and additional territory within its vicinity?
What title was given to a city governor of ancient Sumeria?
questions.explanation:
Ensi.

	The Ensis were presumably subordinate to the lugals in ancient Sumeria.

questions.text: Food staples of the Sumerians included barley, onions, various legumes, the occasional fish and what other grain?
questions.explanation:
Emmer.

	Emmer is a type of coarse wheat which can be grown in various conditions.

questions.text: During the latter part of the early period of Sumerian dynastic history, the capital shifted to a city which was dominated by kings such as Messalim and Eannatum, who took on the ceremonial title of 'King of Kish'. From which city, presided over by its chief god Ningirsu, did these kings rule?
questions.explanation:
Lagash.

	Lagash was an illustrious city on the Persian Gulf at the mouth of the Euphrates River.

questions.text: The Akkadians conquered the cities of Sumeria during the 23rd century B.C. under the powerful rule of Sargon, the first king of Babylon. Sargon's grandson further strengthened the empire and deified himself, taking the title 'King of the Four Quarters of the Universe'. What was this grandson's name?
questions.explanation:
Naram-Sin.

	Apparently, Naram-Sin thought quite highly of himself...he conducted a harsh rule which included the looting of disloyal cities.

questions.text: The Babylonian dynasty was destroyed during the 21st century BC, largely due to incursions by what people of the mountains of Persia?

The 3rd Sumerian dynasty was propagated by Nammu, who revolted against Uterhegal, king of Uruk (who had in turn revolted against Akkadian dominance). Nammu established this 3rd dynasty at what ancient Sumerian city?
questions.explanation:
Ur.

	Ur...where Abraham of the Bible was born!

questions.text: What was the name for the characteristic step temples that characterized Sumerian architecture?
questions.explanation:
Ziggurat.

	This one was a bit of a giveaway!
